str2: A leprous person, a leper. From the same as lepra; scaly, i.e. Leprous.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.
